marketNews.title: Car Sales -5% YoY in March 2025
marketNews.content: Gaikindo recorded that national car wholesales in March 2025 dropped to 70,909 units (-5.1% YoY, -1.9% MoM), along with the shift in Lebaran seasonality and the IIMS 2025 event slightly moving toward February 2025. This result caused national car wholesales for 3M25 to reach 205,136 units (-4.7% YoY), relatively in line with expectations as it's equivalent to 23-27% of Gaikindo's 2025 target of around 750,000-900,000 units (vs. 3M24: 25% of 2024 realization). Here are some highlights of car sales in March 2025: 1. Astra Sales Weak, Though Relatively Better Than Other Japanese Brands Combined, Astra International's two main brands - Toyota + Daihatsu - recorded a decline in sales performance (-5.7% YoY, -2.3% MoM) in March 2025, worse than the industry realization (-5.1% YoY, -1.9% MoM), causing their combined market share to fall to 50.1% in March 2025 (vs. March 2024: 50.4%, February 2025: 50.3%). The decline in ASII's wholesale sales in March 2025 was primarily due to a -21% YoY decline in Daihatsu sales, while Toyota sales grew +6.3% YoY. Cumulatively over 3M25, Toyota + Daihatsu wholesales dropped -6.9% YoY to 103,954 units, worse than the industry decline (-4.7% YoY), so their combined market share for 3M25 fell to 50.7% (vs. 3M24: 51.9%). Meanwhile, sales from other Japanese brands experienced a significant weakening in March 2025, with Honda and Suzuki falling -40.4% YoY and -33.4% YoY, respectively. Cumulatively in 3M25, sales for these two brands dropped -20.4% YoY each. 2. Chinese Brand Sales Continue to Soar BYD recorded sales of 3,205 units in March 2025 (+129% MoM), marking the highest level since BYD entered Indonesia and surpassing Hyundai's sales. With this result, BYD's market share rose significantly to 4.5% in March 2025 (vs. February 2025: 1.9%). Chery again recorded its highest monthly sales of 1,829 units (+128% YoY, +25% MoM), continuing the trend from February 2025. Only Wuling showed a different trend compared to BYD and Chery. Key Takeaway Combining February and March figures—to avoid annual comparisons being distorted by Lebaran seasonality shifts—car sales fell -1.6% YoY. Although weak, this realization is relatively in line with Gaikindo's expectation targeting 2025 car sales to be relatively stagnant compared to 2024. However, the current stagnant market condition tends to be supported by the increasing contribution of Chinese brands, which erodes the market share of Japanese brands. On today's trading, Tuesday (15/4), stock prices for $ASII dropped -1.22%, $AUTO dropped -1.95%, and $DRMA dropped -0.55%.

marketNews.title: OPEC cuts 2025 global oil demand growth forecast, citing US tariffs
marketNews.content: OPEC on Monday (14/4) cut its forecast for global oil demand growth in 2025 to 1.3 million barrels per day and to 1.28 million barrels per day in 2026, both 150,000 barrels per day lower than the previous projection. This is the first downgrade to OPEC's oil demand growth forecast since December 2024 amid escalating trade war due to tariffs imposed by the US.

marketNews.title: Airlangga states import tax discount will be generally applicable, not just for US products
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Monday (14/4) that the reduction of import PPh (Income Tax) tariffs and customs duties will be generally applicable, not only for products originating from the US. Airlangga explained that the adjustment of several import tax tariffs is part of deregulation steps to minimize the negative impact of the application of reciprocal tariffs from the US. Airlangga's statement differs from the Head of the Fiscal Policy Agency of the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Nathan Kacaribu, who said last week that the adjustment of import PPh tariffs and customs duties only applies to products originating from the US.

marketNews.title: US Government pursues semiconductor and pharmaceutical commodity import tariffs by initiating trade investigation
marketNews.content: The US Government continues its plan to impose import tariffs on semiconductor and pharmaceutical commodities by initiating a trade investigation led by the Ministry of Commerce. On Monday (14/4), the US Department of Commerce said that it has started an investigation regarding the national security impact on the US from imports of "semiconductors and semiconductor manufacturing equipment" as well as "pharmaceuticals and pharmaceutical ingredients, including finished drug products." The investigation began on April 1, 2025, with results to be announced within 270 days. Nevertheless, US President Donald Trump and other officials have hinted that the investigation could be resolved sooner.

marketNews.title: Minister of Communication and Digital opens opportunity to lower frequency fees for telecom operators
marketNews.content: Indonesia's Minister of Communication and Digital, Meutya Hafid, said that her ministry is opening the opportunity to lower frequency fees for telecommunication operators. This step is aimed at stabilizing the telecommunications business which requires significant capital. However, Meutya could not confirm when the frequency fee reduction would occur as coordination with other ministries/agencies is still needed.

marketNews.title: Qatar's US$4 Billion Investment Fund focused on priority sectors
marketNews.content: CIO of BPI Danantara, Pandu Sjahrir, said on Monday (14/4) that the joint investment fund with Qatar worth US$4 billion will be focused on priority sectors, including food security, energy security, downstream processing, digital infrastructure, health, and tourism.

marketNews.title: Fore Kopi Indonesia targets 70-80% net profit growth in 2025 after turning profitable in 9M24
marketNews.content: Director of Fore Kopi Indonesia (FORE), Vico Lomar, stated that they are targeting net profit growth of around +70-80% throughout 2025. For comparison, during 9M24, FORE recorded a net profit of 42 billion rupiah (reversing from a loss in 9M23), with revenues of 727 billion rupiah (+135% YoY) and Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) of +42% YoY. FORE is also aiming for an additional 55 new outlets during 2025, targeting a total of 300 outlets by the end of 2025. In the next 5 years, FORE targets 600 outlets.

marketNews.title: Avia Avian Vice President Director increases stake via share purchases
marketNews.content: The Vice President Director of Avia Avian (AVIA), Ruslan Tanoko, purchased approximately 8 million AVIA shares at an average price of 390 rupiah per share on April 8-10, 2025. The total transaction value reached 3.1 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Ruslan's ownership in AVIA increased from 0.0609% to 0.0738%.

marketNews.title: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada (CMNP) plans rights issue for subsidiary funding
marketNews.content: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada (CMNP) plans to hold a rights issue of up to ~2.2 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 25%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the funds raised are intended for capital injection or loans to subsidiaries for toll road construction. This plan will be discussed at the EGMS on May 22, 2025.

marketNews.title: Indosat (ISAT) plans to expand business activities
marketNews.content: Indosat (ISAT) plans to expand its business activities to include, but are not limited to, telecommunication activities specifically for defense and security purposes, telecommunication resale services, artificial intelligence-based programming activities, consulting and design activities for the Internet of Things (IoT), payment system support providers, as well as advertising and market research services. This plan will be discussed at the GMS on May 28, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) and partner inject capital into PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific along with its business partner, Phoenix Power B.V. (a subsidiary of Thailand's EGCO Group), conducted a capital injection of 1.75 trillion rupiah into PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk through a new share issuance. Of this amount, TPIA injected 850 billion rupiah, while Phoenix Power B.V. injected 900 billion rupiah. After this capital injection transaction, TPIA's ownership in PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk decreased from 70% to 66.7%, while Phoenix Power B.V.'s ownership increased from 30% to 33.3%.

tickerNews.title: PANI and CBDK announce 2025 marketing sales targets and PIK 2 toll road update
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua management in an analyst meeting on Tuesday (15/4) announced a marketing sales target of 5.3 trillion rupiah for 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 6 trillion rupiah, down -12% YoY), with target sales contributions from shop houses at 43%, landed houses at 36%, and land plots at 21%. Meanwhile, Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) targets marketing sales of 2 trillion rupiah throughout 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 2.1 trillion rupiah, down -4% YoY), with target contributions from shop house sales at 54%, land plots at 34%, and houses at 12%. PANI management estimates that the first 7 km of the Kataraja toll road connecting Soekarno-Hatta Airport and PIK 2 could be completed and operational around May-June 2025. Furthermore, management estimates that the CBDK MICE building, Nusantara International Convention and Exhibition, will partially operate in October 2025 and contribute 10-15% of revenue by 2027.

tickerNews.title: ACES provides 2025 guidance, proposes high dividend payout ratio for 2024
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia management in an earnings call on Tuesday (15/4) provided revenue growth guidance of +5% YoY during 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: +13% YoY), with a Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) target of +1% YoY (vs. 2024 realization: +8.8% YoY). ACES will allocate capex of about 250-300 billion rupiah during 2025, with a target of opening around 25-30 new outlets. ACES management also proposed a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year with a payout ratio greater than 50% (vs. 2023 payout ratio: 75%), implying a minimum dividend of 26 rupiah per share with an indicative dividend yield of 5.3% as of Tuesday (15/4).

tickerNews.title: INTP plans share buyback and withdrawal of shares from previous buybacks
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa plans a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 2.25 trillion rupiah from May 22, 2025, to May 21, 2026, although the company did not specify the maximum number of shares to be bought. In addition, INTP also plans to retire some shares from the results of the 2021-2024 buyback, with the number of shares retired not exceeding 165.6 million (4.5%) shares. Both plans will be discussed at the GMS and EGMS on May 21, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) plans 2024 dividend distribution
tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga plans to distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~3.9 trillion rupiah or 155.73 rupiah per share, equivalent to a 57.4% dividend payout ratio. The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is April 23, 2025, with payment on May 14, 2025. Referring to BNGA's share price at the close of trading on Tuesday (15/4) at 1,825 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 8.5%.

tickerNews.title: Pakuwon Jati (PWON) Q1 2025 marketing sales reach 18.4% of target
tickerNews.content: Pakuwon Jati recorded marketing sales of 330.7 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-14% YoY, -23% QoQ), equivalent to 18.4% of the 2025 target of 1.8 trillion rupiah. The largest contribution to marketing sales came from the condominium segment (51%), followed by landed houses (46%), and office space (3%). A total of 59% of marketing sales in 1Q25 came from products eligible for VAT DTP (Value Added Tax Absorption facility).

tickerNews.title: Alam Sutera Realty (ASRI) Q1 2025 marketing sales up 30% YoY
tickerNews.content: Alam Sutera Realty recorded marketing sales of 745.3 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+30% YoY, -13% QoQ), equivalent to 21.3% of the 2025 target of 3.5 trillion rupiah. The largest contribution to marketing sales came from the residential segment (60%), driven by sales in the Sutera Rasuna cluster which accounted for 48% of the total residential segment. Meanwhile, the remaining marketing sales came from the commercial segment.

tickerNews.title: PTBA is studying coal gasification feasibility while SNG project is in feasibility study with PGAS
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Bukit Asam, Arsal Ismail, stated that the company will support the government's direction regarding coal downstreaming projects, including the coal gasification project to produce dimethyl ether (DME) and substitute natural gas (SNG). Arsal mentioned that PTBA will conduct a careful study regarding the DME project, considering that its previous partner, Air Products & Chemicals Inc., withdrew from the project in 2023. Arsal stated that PTBA no longer wants to merely be a supplier in the DME project going forward and wants to be more deeply involved. Meanwhile, the SNG project is still in the feasibility study stage with Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS).
